materials.raw_text: Acetate (Ac): 10 g, Beryllium (Be): 5 g, Nickel (Ni): 80 g, Silicon (Si): 45 g

sourcing.instructions: Acetate can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online chemical retailers. Beryllium may be obtained from specialty metals suppliers. Nickel is commonly available at hardware stores or metal suppliers. Silicon can be sourced from chemical supply companies or electronics suppliers.
steps: Acetate can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online chemical retailers. Beryllium may be obtained from specialty metals suppliers. Nickel is commonly available at hardware stores or metal suppliers. Silicon can be sourced from chemical supply companies or electronics suppliers.

1. Wear appropriate safety gear including gloves and goggles. 2. In a clean and dry mixing container, measure 10 g of Acetate. 3. Add 5 g of Beryllium to the container. 4. Next, add 80 g of Nickel to the mixture. 5. Finally, add 45 g of Silicon to the container. 6. Using a non-reactive mixing tool, stir the mixture thoroughly for 10 minutes to ensure an even blend of all components. 7. Ensure the mixture is homogeneous and free from lumps.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Wear appropriate safety gear including gloves and goggles. 2. In a clean and dry mixing container, measure 10 g of Acetate. 3. Add 5 g of Beryllium to the container. 4. Next, add 80 g of Nickel to the mixture. 5. Finally, add 45 g of Silicon to the container. 6. Using a non-reactive mixing tool, stir the mixture thoroughly for 10 minutes to ensure an even blend of all components. 7. Ensure the mixture is homogeneous and free from lumps.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Once the furnace reaches the desired temperature, transfer the mixed material into a suitable crucible. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to facilitate the melting and blending of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1200 °C. 2. Once the furnace reaches the desired temperature, transfer the mixed material into a suitable crucible. 3. Place the crucible in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to facilitate the melting and blending of the materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to ambient temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door during the cooling process to prevent thermal shock and cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to ambient temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace door during the cooling process to prevent thermal shock and cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw or grinder to cut or shape the solid sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a suitable coating to enhance durability and appearance.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw or grinder to cut or shape the solid sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a suitable coating to enhance durability and appearance.
